instructions.description: Instructions for running this tool. Any parameters that are not given a value will be guessed based on the instructions.
Instructions for running this tool. Any parameters that are not given a value will be guessed based on the instructions.

query.description: This is a gmail query search. Examples of queries include specifying sender (from:amy), recipient (to:david), words in the subject line (subject:dinner), matching multiple terms (from:amy OR from:david), excluding terms (dinner -movie), searching for an exact word or phrase ("dinner and movie tonight"), attachments (has:attachment, filename:pdf), labels (label:friends), and time periods (after:YYYY-MM-DD, before:YYYY-MM-DD). Users can also search by categories (category:updates), message size (larger:10M), and more. When asked vaguely to return the last, latest, or any email from their inbox, use in:inbox to do the lookup.

body_type.description: Specify content's type of the email to draft. It should default to 'html' unless specified otherwise.

zapier_google_sheets_create_spreadsheet.name: zapier_google_sheets_create_spreadsheet
zapier_google_sheets_create_spreadsheet.description: Creates a new spreadsheet. Choose from a blank spreadsheet, a copy of an existing one, or one with headers.

instructions.description: Instructions for running this tool. Any parameters that are not given a value will be guessed based on the instructions.

headers.description: Enter column headers for your new spreadsheet. These will be ignored if “Spreadsheet to Copy” is selected. Headers are REQUIRED for spreadsheets that will be used with add_row or update_row operations. Without headers in the first row, these operations will fail, unless you call Create Column later.
